abstract.text: Asks the delegate to provide an alternative text value used for type selection for the specified row and column.

A string that is used in type select comparison for
Implement this method to change the string value that is searched for based on what is displayed. By default, all cells with text in them are searched.
If this delegate method isnâ€™t implemented, the default string value (which can also be returned from the delegate method) is:

abstract.text: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your macOS app.
The display characteristics and identifier for a column in a table view.
A set of related records, displayed in rows that represent individual records and columns that represent the attributes of those records.
A set of optional methods you implement in a table view delegate to customize the behavior of the table view.
Asks the delegate if the user is allowed to change the selection.
Asks the delegate for the row within the specified search range that matches the specified string.
Asks the delegate to accept or reject the proposed selection.
Asks the delegate whether the specified table column can be selected.
Asks the delegate if the table view should allow selection of the specified row.
Asks the delegate to allow or deny type select for the specified event and current search string.
Asks the delegate to provide an alternative text value used for type selection for the specified row and column.
Tells the delegate that the table viewâ€™s selection has changed.
Tells the delegate that the table viewâ€™s selection is in the process of changing.
A static, plain-text Unicode string object which you use when you need reference semantics or other Foundation-specific behavior.
A Unicode string value that is a collection of characters.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
